p: We selected compounds with quantitative IC 50 values as data set, and divided the 11 compounds randomly into a training set (nine compounds) and a testing set (three compounds). We converted the IC 50 values to pIC 50 values with the formula pIC 50 = Δlog IC 50. We used the pIC 50 values to develop the 3D-QSAR model by combining the activity data with the generated hypothesis. The chemical structures and biological activities of the 11 compounds are listed in Table 1. We used the Sybyl-X2.1.1 molecular model package to perform the modeling studies.
